data.name: 8 Wired Brewing Company
data.description:
A microbrewing company based in Marlborough, New Zealand.

To produce mindblowing beers that will wow craftbeer lovers, excite fellow beer geeks and educate the mis-guided who still believe that

data.name: 8th Wonder Brewing Company
data.description:
A crafty brewery in HouTex. Our proximity to Minute Maid Park, Toyota Center & Dynamo Stadium, makes 8W the craft beer for the home team. 

We are dedicated to brewing fresh, tasty artisanal ales.

data.name: 961 BEER
data.description:
961 Beer began during the dark days of the July 2006 siege on Lebanon. Tired with the lack of quality beer in Lebanon, Mazen Hajjar and his friends started to brew beer in his very own kitchen. The first batches were brewed in 20 liter kettles. Granted that war and blockades are not the ideal conditions to start a company, alongside everyone telling them they were mad to even consider it, they went ahead with it anyway. They decided that brewing a good beer for a great country was what they wanted to do the most.

When 961 Beer officially began brewing they were one of the smallest breweries in the world, and the only microbrewery in the Middle East (and still are). Although 961 Beer now brews nearly 2 million liters per year, they still insist upon making beer using the very same principles: traditional techniques, quality ingredients and love.

data.name: A l'abri de la Tempête
data.description:
Located in the Îles de la Madeleine , L'Etang-du-Nord in a former fish processing plant, the microbrewery A l'abri de la Tempête (Shelter From The Storm) enjoys a prime location on the seafront, with breathtaking views to the west. Before you go to relax on the beach or after a busy day of sand and salt water, take a refreshing break in our tasting room.

A l'abri de la Tempête promotes the use of local raw materials in the design of their beers. That began with the transformation of barley malt, it continues its momentum with the harvest of flowers, seaweed and fresh herbs. The use of local resources is a guarantee of authenticity and freshness that contributes to the design of unique beers and sleek.

data.name: À la Fût
data.description:
À la Fût microbrewery is located in the heart of the small town of Saint-Tite, in the beautiful region of Mauricie. Whether you're a connoisseur or, conversely, whether you want to introduce you to the pleasures of craft beer, enjoy our delicious beer.

Our Brewpub, which can accommodate more than 60 guests, is distinguished by its relaxed atmosphere and picturesque views. Built in 1865, the place has a rich history which is one of the oldest buildings in the municipality. Moreover, it served as a general store in the time of the Daughters of Caleb. We find today all the architectural style of the time.

data.name: A1A Ale Works
data.description: Handcrafted and brewed to excellence, A1A Ale Works goes to great lengths to serve each guest the freshest beer possible. This commitment to serving nothing but the finest and freshest beer has led to numerous awards.

data.name: Aachener Brauhaus Degraa
data.description:
When Helmut Schwichtenberg, a descendant of the Degraa Family, secured the trademark rights for DEGRAA in 2007, he laid the cornerstone for a new era. One year later, he commissioned an extensive market research study that showed what a beer from Aachen should taste like.

His father, Karl-Heinz Schwichtenberg, was the last DEGRAA master and manager of the DEGRAA restaurant near the town theater for over 20 years. His grandmother, Käthe Schwichtenberg, ran the DEGRAA am Hansemann – better known as the “Os Oche” – for over 25 years. His great grandmother, Katharina Vonderbank, née Degraa, was the head of Josef Degraa Erben KG until her death; Josef Degraa Erben KG had been founded by her father, Josef Degraa, in 1888.

Ever since that time, the DEGRAA brand has been well known, even beyond Germany’s borders.

data.name: Aarhus Bryghus
data.description:
Aarhus Brewery makes special beer for enjoyment! That is to say that art is not so advanced as to result in afskræmmende and can only be drunk by connoisseurs. Anyone who wants to try something new, you will find joy in Aarhus Brewery products.

Aarhus Brewery makes special beer with between 5 and 9% alcohol, bottled in large 60 cl bottles. There will be a beer which will be suitable as an aperitif beer, which beer will be suitable for fish and meat dishes light, and there will be dark, heavy and bulky beers, which are suitable for meats and cheeses.

It builds both fixed beers and varying seasonal beers. Read more in products.

The brewery is purely a production brewery that produces beer and brave this in bottles and kegs. There is not affiliated catering to the brewery. On the other hand we do tours for small groups of between 15 and 75 people.

data.name: Aass Brewery
data.description: Aass Brewery was established in 1834 and is the oldest brewery in Norway today. It is located in the city of Drammen, approximately 25 miles south of our capital, Oslo. You will spot it at the banks of the Drammen River at the very same place as it has been since 1834. The annual production of beer is aprox. 10 mill liter (85 000 barrels), and together with the production of 18 mill liters of soft drinks and mineralwater it gives employment to approximately 150 people.  You may wonder how we got our name ? It was a young fellow with the name Poul Lauritz Aass that bought the brewery in 1860. Since then it has been in the same family, and is today run by the 4th generation of Aass. (By the way - A real Norwegian viking would pronounce it Ouse)  The brewery is proud of its history. To us the quality of what we produce has always been and always will be the main issue. In 1516, Duke Wilhelm of Bavaria established a law admitting only malted barley, hops yeast, and water as ingredients in the production of beer. The law is known as the purity law and Aass Brewery is still loyal to Duke Wilhelm of Bavaria. In Norway the brewery is known for outstanding quality and large number of different beer types.

data.name: Abandon Brewing Company
data.description: Overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, we will be brewing many different styles of craft beer for the Penn Yan and surrounding Finger Lakes areas.

data.name: Abbaye de Maredsous
data.description: Beer Maredsous is a beer Belgian of high fermentation brewed by Moortgat. Curiously, this beer has never been produced at the site of the abbey Benedictine of Maredsous. to Denéein Namur province. However, we can enjoy the on-site in earthen mugs. Since 1963, the abbey has entrusted the production and marketing at the brewery Duvel Moortgat located Puurs (province ofAntwerp), (which also gives us the Duvel) under the control of the monks. The beer is filtered before bottling, giving it very clear.

data.name: Abbey Ales Brewery
data.description:
Founded in 1997, Abbey Ales is the first and only brewery in the historic City of Bath for over forty years, and is the initiative of experienced brewery sales and marketing manager Alan Morgan.

Bellringer is the only cask beer continuously produced at the Abbey Brewery, a golden 4.2% abv best bitter.

Successfully launched at the Bath CAMRA beer festival in October 1997 Bellringer is now the top selling cask bitter in the World Heritage City of Bath and is as popular with the many visitors to the Georgian City as it is with Bathonians.

data.name: Abbey Beverage Company
data.description:
Abbey Beverage Company is the producer of Monks' Ale and Monks' Wit. Monks' Ale has been available in New Mexico since December of 2005 and Monks' Wit since October of 2010.

The Benedictine monks of the Monastery of Christ in the Desert control 84 % of the Abbey Beverage Company through a separate corporation called St. Luke's Corporation. In the spring of 2010, they acquired the small minority interest of the Monastery of Our Lady of Guadalupe in Pecos, New Mexico.

The products are brewed on a small scale at the Monastery of Our Lady of Guadalupe in a closed brewery (no guests are allowed) and under contract at Sierra Blanca Brewing Company in Moriarty. Abbey Beverage Company controls all the key ingredients and packaging materials at Sierra Blanca Brewing Company.

A new brewery is under construction at the Monastery of Christ in the Desert. It is scheduled for completion in 2010. Brewing will be done in this new, separate facility after the commercial brewing licenses are transferred in 2011. This facility will start as a pilot brewery and slowly expand to produce Monks' Ale and Monks' Wit in draft, and seasonal draft beers. This brewery will be open for visits on a limited basis.

data.name: Abbey Brewing Co
data.description: Miami Beach's world famous Abbey Brewing Company is home to award winning, hand crafted beers, friendly service, and a down to Earth atmosphere. One of the oldest bars in Miami, it has the old world charm of a traditional European pub

data.name: Abbey Wright Brewing Company
data.description: The Valley Inn & Abbey Wright Brewing Co. have a superb selection of our own hand-crafted beers. We also have 22 beers on tap, and a huge selection of bottled beer from around the world.

data.name: Abbeydale Brewery
data.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

data.name: Aberdeen Brewing
data.description: Aberdeen Brewing Company

data.name: Abigaile Brewery
data.description: Abigaile is an effort by Hermosa Beach local Jed Sanford to bring a distinctive take on the American brasserie experience to Hermosa Beach; all in a communal setting that celebrates the location’s rich history as a gathering place for locals from all walks of life.

data.name: Abigale Brewing Co
data.description: Inspired by the hop heritage of nearby Wye and with a particular interest in the flavours of the hop varieties that have been developed at Wye in the past, Abigale Brewing Company craft their ales in the heart of Kent using the finest quality ingredients.

data.name: Abita Brewing Company
data.description: Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans. In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100 seat brew pub) and were forced to move up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand. Today, we brew over 62,000 barrels of beer and 3,000 barrels of root beer, and we're still growing! But don't let our growth fool you. Our lagers and ales are still brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews. Abita uses only the finest ingredients  British and American barley, German yeast, European and Washington State hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs. In Abita, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way. Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes. We're proud of our brewery and the beers we make. Try Abita Beer today and taste a bit of the South!

data.name: Åbro Bryggeri
data.description: The brewery was founded in 1856 by Lieutenant Per W Luthander. The brewery was purchased in 1898 by brewer Axel Herman Johansson and it is still owned by the family. Despite, or perhaps because of, that we are the country's oldest family brewery, we have always focused on development. Our large production investments have resulted in one of Europe's most modern breweries, with the high and consistent quality is guaranteed by our own water source since 1856.

data.name: AC Golden Brewing Company
data.description: The AC Golden Brewing Company is a subsidiary of MillerCoors, a joint venture between SABMiller and Molson Coors Brewing Company. Its purpose is to serve as a specialty brewing arm of MillerCoors, in the words of president Glenn Knippenberg, "Our mission for AC Golden is to be a brand incubator for what is now MillerCoors". The AC Golden Brewery operates in the former pilot brewery of the Coors Brewery. It debuted its first beer, Herman Joseph's Private Reserve, in 2008. The company began brewing its seasonal beer, a Vienna Style lager called Winterfest, in 2009. In April 2010, AC Golden introduced Colorado Native lager in Colorado, an amber lager made with 100% Colorado ingredients.

data.name: Acadian Farms
data.description: Nestled in the fertile Carson valley, Acadian Farms is a small family farm and nano-brewery. We believe the old adage, "You are what you eat", so we organically raise our vegetables and animals. We use certified organic barley & malt in our beers and we bake our artisan breads with all natural and/or organic flours from Bob's Red Mill.  Our farmstead cheeses are made with raw milk from grass-fed goats at a local dairy. We invite you out to the farm for a pint and views of the beautiful Columbia River Gorge!

data.name: Achel Brewery
data.description: Achel brewery or Brouwerij der Sint-Benedictusabdij de Achelse Kluis is a Belgian Trappist brewery, and the smallest of the seven currently approved Trappist breweries. It is located in the Abbey of Saint Benedict in the Belgian municipality of Achel. It brews five trappist beers

data.name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley
data.description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.

data.name: Acoustic Draft Mead
data.description: BzZz Loves You

data.name: Ad Lib Brewing Company
data.description:
In 2011 a plan was hatched. Two flatmates Hayden and Fraser decided that they would start their own brewery. A month, and many beers later Ad Lib was born. The first beer UCom was made at the Twisted Hop, but due to the February earthquake this beer was never released.

The quake only reinforced Ad Libs' belief, that they should continue, and a new premise and new inspiration was found. The good blokes at Wigram brewery gave them a hand and the magic that is Ad Lib Brewing finally reached you!

data.name: Addlestones
data.description:
Based in Shepton Mallet in the heart of Somerset, our cider mill has been pressing cider of exceptional quality for over one hundred years.

Addlestones was first produced by our team of master cider makers in 1986, and is so popular amongst our loyal consumers; it is now the UK’s leading specialist draught cider.

data.name: Adelbert's Brewery
data.description:
Adelbert's Brewery is named as a tribute to George Adelbert Hovey (1953-2000), the founder’s brother.  Del always took time to enjoy a good beer with family and friends.  He visited and resided in many regions of the world, whole heartedly embracing the local people.  He was a generous individual genuinely concerned with the welfare of everyone he met.   Whether he was working with the president of his company or a worker hand-pollinating flowers in a green house he treated all with respect and dignity.   He lived to a high standard of empathy and self sacrifice.   

Our Mission is to brew Belgian Style bottle conditioned beers that people will seek, savor and share with others.

data.name: Adirondack Pub & Brewery
data.description: All of our craft-brewed beers are made on the premises using only the finest malt, hops, yeast and water. We currently produce these beers on a 15-barrel Bohemian copper brewhouse. Our fermantation capacity is 60 barrels (1,860 gallons), with an even larger serving capacity in our cold cellars. We invite you to taste hand-crafted beer at its finest. Look for Adirondack Pub & Brewery's hand-crafted beers at great establishments throughout New York State.

data.name: Adkin Brewery
data.description:
The Adkin Brewery was originally founded as a hobby in early 2000.  It is a true example of a small cottage brewery, and is run by the sole proprietor, Mr Shaun Cunningham, from the garage attached to his house on a housing estate in Wantage, Oxfordshire.  All of Shaun's beers are produced using only natural ingredients, most of which are supplied by Best Mates Brewery, Ardington and Ken Thomas of Arkwright's Homebrew in Highworth, near Swindon, Wiltshire www.arkwrightshomebrew.com.

At the moment, Shaun still has a full-time job.  Despite the restrictions placed upon Shaun in terms of both time and space, you can see from the photographs just how much can be achieved in a small, basic garage.  As for the quality of the products, well, that speaks for itself!

data.name: Adler-Brauerei Max Haag Nachf Wolfgang Haag
